title: How to Hold a Rubik's Cube

steps.headline: Place your thumbs on the left and right stickers in the middle row of the front face.
Place your middle fingers on the left and right stickers in the middle row of the back face.
To rotate the left and right faces, turn your left or right hand with your wrist.
To rotate the top face, flick inward with one of your index fingers.
To rotate the bottom face, flick inward with one of your ring fingers.
Alternatively, you can push outward with your index or ring finger to rotate the top or bottom faces.
steps.description: This is useful if your other hand has just performed a wrist turn (on the left or right faces) and is out of place.

steps.headline: Use your index finger and thumb.
steps.description: You might also turn the front face by temporarily gripping the top of the cube with your index finger and pulling it with your thumb.

steps.headline: Curl your index finger.
steps.description: The front face might also be turned by curling your index finger inwards, but only if your other hand is in a different grip.

text: Place your thumbs on the left and right stickers in the middle row of the front face.  Place your middle fingers on the left and right stickers in the middle row of the back face.  To rotate the left and right faces, turn your left or right hand with your wrist.  To rotate the top face, flick inward with one of your index fingers.  To rotate the bottom face, flick inward with one of your ring fingers.  Alternatively, you can push outward with your index or ring finger to rotate the top or bottom faces. This is useful if your other hand has just performed a wrist turn (on the left or right faces) and is out of place. Use your index finger and thumb. You might also turn the front face by temporarily gripping the top of the cube with your index finger and pulling it with your thumb. Curl your index finger. The front face might also be turned by curling your index finger inwards, but only if your other hand is in a different grip.
